statement:
For $n\ge r \ge 0$, the binomial coefficient $${n \choose r}$$ is an
integer.

The proof is by induction on $n$. For $n=0$, the claim is clear. Thus,
suppose the claim holds for $n\ge 1$. For $r=1,\ldots, n$, Pascal’s rule
gives $${n +1 \choose r} = {n\choose r} + {n\choose r-1}.$$ That is,
${n +1 \choose 1}, \ldots, {n+1 \choose n}$ are integers. Since
$${n +1\choose 0} = 1, \quad   {n +1\choose n+1} = 1$$ the proof is
complete.
